intro: Cleome glauca, commonly known as the Mexican Marvel or spider flower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom from late spring to early fall. Cleome glauca is known for its ability to thrive in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. Its unique, spider-like appearance and low maintenance requirements contribute to its appeal in gardens and landscapes.
